page.title: 02ABOUT WANBOROUGH
page.content: y. on the historical side mention must also be made of the monastery in lower reigions, surround by a moat and served by a busy mill . consequently, we have a network of paths and tracks used by the mules and pack-hores leading to the mill,which is now a dry heap of rubble because of a Thames Waterboard diversion of the River Cole. The village is in two parts,upper and lower,with a steep hillside full of springs between them.At the top is the church which boasts a tower and a spire dating from the 15th-16th C.For years Wanborough was a self supporting community with lots of rural crafts,now its character is completely changed,building development and communications have taken people out of the village to work.It is still a lively village to live in!
